subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






June 22, 2007

TOP STORIESSix Flags Closes More Rides After Accident
After a 13-year-old girl had her feet chopped off at the ankle on a Superman Tower of Power in Kentucky, Six Flags and another
                        company shut down eight more thrill rides around the country, including a ride at a North Carolina amusement park. More...Watch: Girl Loses Feet On Thrill Ride
• Atlantis Aims For California Landing
                     					| Watch• Sheriff: Found Baby Isn't Missing Mom's
                     					| Watch• Nation's Firefighters Mourn Their Own
                     					| WatchU.S.Sheriff: Found Baby Isn't Missing Mom's
A baby found on an Ohio doorstep does not belong to a missing pregnant woman, Wayne County Sheriff Thomas Maurer said. The
                        baby was left outside a home about 45 miles from where Jessie Davis lived. More...Watch: Pregnant Mom Still Missing
• U.S. May Move Detainees To Afghan Prison• Nation's Firefighters Mourn Their Own
                     					| Watch• "Killer King" L.A. Hospital In Peril• More StoriesWorldOfficial: Iran Open To Nuclear Compromise
Iran is ready to provide answers on past suspicious nuclear activities to the International Atomic Energy Agency within the
                        next few months, the agency's head said after meeting with the country's top nuclear negotiator. More...
• Air Strikes Kill 17 Iraq Al Qaeda Fighters
                     					| Watch• Lebanon Says Militants Defeated• Hamas Is Excluded From Mideast Peace Talks• More StoriesPoliticsBush Pushes Vietnam Leader On Human Rights
As hundreds of protestors across the street called for the release of political prisoners in Vietnam, President Bush voiced
                        similar concerns at the end of his Oval Office meeting with Vietnamese President Nguyen Minh Triet. More...
• Illinois Governor Has Pricey Commute• Nonprofit Kept Edwards In '08 Spotlight• Romney Staff Involved In 2 Investigations• More StoriesHealthFDA Cracks Down On Dietary Supplements
The FDA has announced that, for the first time, manufacturers of vitamins, herbal pills and other dietary supplements will
                        have to test all of their products' ingredients. More...
• Baby Formula Goes On Trial In Asia• New Scrutiny For Omega-3 Eggs• Study: First Born Have Higher IQs • More StoriesSciTechAtlantis Aims For California Landing
Space shuttle Atlantis headed for a landing at its backup location in California after rain and clouds over Florida ruled
                        out a touchdown at the Kennedy Space Center. More...Watch: Storms Delay Shuttle Landing
• "Green" Light Bulb Buying Guide• Control The TV With Your Mind• Video Game Addiction: A Medical Disorder?
                     					| Watch• More StoriesBusinessHow To Survive The Office Bully
Many people caught in the clutches of the office tyrant decide to quit ... but not everyone has the freedom to do so.  More...
• Tips For Hassle-Free Air Travel• Air Travel With Kids Made Easy
                     					| Watch• Planning Perfect Yard, Tag, Garage Sale
                     					| Watch• More StoriesEntertainmentHilton's New Passion: Helping Inmates
In the second part of her exclusive interview with Ryan Seacrest, Paris Hilton said she plans to build a "transitional home"
                        to aid inmates after they complete their time in jail.  More...Watch: Neighbors Want Paris Evicted
• Steve Carell Loves Birds. Really.
                     					| Watch• Hasselhoff Demands Apology From Tabloid• Angelina Jolie Tackles Daniel Pearl Story
                     					| Watch• More StoriesOpinionMichael Moore's Imperfect Diagnosis
Michael Moore's tactics, including those used in his latest film, "Sicko," may infuriate people on the right and left. But
                        The New Republic says most of his arguments against the U.S. health care industry are deadly accurate. More...Watch: Moore, "Sicko" In Cannes
• Bloomberg's Small-Time Tease
                     					| Watch• Is Vice President's Office Above The Law?• The Bloomberg Terminal
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Angelina Jolie Tackles Daniel Pearl Story
Wall Street Journal reporter Daniel Pearl was murdered by Islamic extremists in Pakistan in 2002. Now, Angelina Jolie portrays
                        Pearl's widow Mariane in a new film titled "A Mighty Heart." More...Watch: 'A Mighty' Angelina Jolie

Big Blast At Wisconsin PlantCBS News RAW: A massive explosion at a Wisconsin chemical recycling company forced the evacuation of nearby homes and
                                    businesses as a safety precaution.
